subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests
msgSnippet: ... Not any more... David has clarified the behaviour here (though exactly _how_ it knows what the parameter value is I don t know). OTH, it wouldn t be a big
messageBody:
On 21/10/05, Alexandru Popescu <the.mindstorm.mailinglist@...> wrote:
> Are you saying that f.e. Eclipse plugin is keepin' loaded in the memory all the failed test
> instances just to be sure you can press rerun failed?

Not any more... David has clarified the behaviour here (though exactly
_how_ it knows what the parameter value is I don't know).

OTH, it wouldn't be a big deal if it did. It's keeping the test
results in memory (for the JUnit GUI view), and tests that have a lot
of state have the tearDown method available to clear it up. The
instances could be discarded when a new test suite is started.

Robert.
--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
